meanings.sent1: The loud noise was aversive to the scared dog.
meanings.sent2: The bitter taste of the medicine was aversive to the child.
meanings.sent3: The aversive sound of the alarm clock made waking up even harder.
meanings.sent4: The aversive smell of burnt popcorn filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The aversive feeling of stepping on a sharp rock made him jump.

meanings.definition: A stimulus that is unpleasant or undesirable.
meanings.sent1: The electric shock served as an aversive to discourage bad behavior.
meanings.sent2: The foul smell in the room was an aversive for the guests.
meanings.sent3: The aversive of having to clean up after the party was not appealing.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise of traffic acted as an aversive to peaceful sleep.
meanings.sent5: The aversive of losing his favorite toy made the child upset.

meanings.definition: Showing a strong dislike or opposition.
meanings.sent1: Her aversive reaction to the idea was clear from her expression.
meanings.sent2: The aversive attitude of the student towards the new rule was evident.
meanings.sent3: His aversive response to broccoli was always amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The aversive stance of the team captain surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The aversive look on her face made him rethink his decision.
